Subject: Wind Energy Market Accelerates with 11.7% CAGR, Energy Storage Surges Amid Policy Shifts  

**Executive Summary:**  
The wind energy market is projected to grow from $141.16B in 2025 to $219.67B by 2029 (11.7% CAGR), driven by renewable adoption and hybrid system innovations. Energy storage faces a pivotal year with advancing policies and a global push for 1,500 GW capacity by 2030, while solar/wind costs continue declining.  

**Key Points:**  
• **Market movements**: Global wind energy market to hit $219.67B by 2029 (11.7% CAGR)[1], with battery storage costs falling to $104/MWh in 2024[6]. Solar/wind now undercut fossil fuels in most markets[6].  
• **Policy changes**: US Inflation Reduction Act and EU Green Deal bolster renewables M&A[2][12]; Virginia mandates 10,000 MW storage by 2045[7]. China’s 60% global turbine capacity may pressure project costs[2].  
• **Trading implications**: Focus on wind-solar hybrids, AI-integrated turbines[1][2], and storage tech (BESS, thermal)[3]. Watch APAC wind leaders (China, Japan, Korea)[2] and US/Europe policy shifts under new administrations[11][12].  

**Outlook:**  
Wind and storage markets will remain bullish through 2025, supported by COP29 storage targets and cost-competitive renewables. However, geopolitical risks (US tariffs, Taiwan Strait tensions)[2] and supply chain volatility[6] could temper growth. M&A activity will intensify in solar/wind projects, while AI-driven operational efficiencies and recyclable turbines[1][3] offer alpha opportunities. Energy storage valuations may rise as IRENA’s revenue-stacking frameworks gain traction[3].  

**Sources:**
